page.title: 16Stanbrook Abbey.
page.content: The Malvern_Worcester area has been a popular part of the county for clusters of monastic houses over the centuries,but now the only remaining example is at Callow End. The Benedictine community was started in 1623 by 9 young English women, forced to move to Flanders. They returned to England and stayed in Warwickshire, until moving to a new Gothic_Revival building at Callow End in 1835. The monastic enclosure had 19 acres of orchards,fields,a garden,a pond,and the brook that gave the site its name. The 50 sisters follow the traditional elements in Benedict's daily routine, but also have time for recreational pursuits. Some of the tasks they do at Stanbrook include caring for the sick, weaving,woodcarving,writing,printing, translating,making paper and cooking.
